experience.company_name: The Lakshmi Mittal and Family South Asia Institute, Harvard University
experience.summary:
Fall 2020: Developed and implemented print and social media strategies to promote Harvard University’s research and in-region programs in South Asian countries. Helped organize '24 Hours of Harvard’ during the Harvard Worldwide Week. Intensively used Adobe Creative Cloud and design software for photo and video making. The Lakshmi Mittal and Family South Asian Institute, Harvard University (The Mittal Institute) is a university-wide research institute at Harvard that engages faculty members, students, and in-region institutions through interdisciplinary programs to disseminate knowledge, build capacity, inform policy, and engage with issues that are shaping South Asia today.As a communications intern, I worked to maximize Harvard's Mittal Institute’s social and print media presence, closely interacted with experts, scholars, and faculty in a variety of interdisciplinary fields, and also contributed to Harvard's events, programs, research, and partnerships.
            

    
    

    
        Show less

Scraped and cleaned climate Data (>1PB), validated CMIP-6 models, and made predictions for future temperature and precipitation for a city plagued with yearly cyclones (Kolkata) under 3 SSP scenarios. Worked with Tristan Ballard, PhD. Polygence Research Program
Summer 2020: Led a media team for the Global Shapers’ “Rebuild Bengal” campaign in Kolkata and helped raise US$15,000 in relief after supercyclone Amphan rampaged through the region.

Built a website to digitalize practice test papers across 6 high schools in hometown Kolkata. Generated 2000+ viewers and 10,000+ views in one month. Made an online repository of 1000+ past test papers sorted school and subject-wise.Academic Reserve is an online repository for class notes, study resources, past papers, and more for high-school and college students. It aims to serve as a network to help students connect with each other across various platforms to discuss projects and gives way to increased intellectual collaboration.It also had a few products:1. Experience College: to help applicants/incoming freshmen connect to any college student/alum at a university in order to network or get a first-hand experience of life at college.2. Study Buddy: to help students find online study groups to take online courses together, track progress, foster discussion, and boost productivity.3. Upgrade: to help the student entrepreneurs/problem solvers connect to incubators, and receive free consultation to grow their enterprises/ideas from field experts. We also help students set up websites, mobile applications, and softwares, specific to their purpose and needs.Academic Reserve repository has over 1000 study resources, past papers etc. and our network expands into over 100 universities world-wide.
            

    
    

    
        Show less

Bangla Machinery Bank (a subsidiary of Yindu & Zhongguo Inc) is an AgriTech enterprise servicing farmers in West Bengal with efficient farm machinery to cut costs and increase crop yield.We currently offer Rice and Combine Harvesters to farmers on a Machinery-as-a-Service (MaaS) model.Our service has helped our customers reduce costs from INR 6000/acre to INR 4000/acre.Apart from these services, our team also provides farmers with the necessary know-how to combat regional climate change impacts, reduce runoffs, and give way to more sustainable farming.

publications.name: Dynamic, Animated Feedback for Randomized Problems with Computer-Based Testing
publications.summary:
Computer-based testing (CBT) is becoming more common in CS Education spaces, and offers many advantages over paper-based modalities. For example, computerized assessments make it easier for students to learn from a wider range of questions in problem sets through problem randomization. Students can then work on problem after problem in a formative assessment mode of learning. While computer-based assessments help facilitate randomized prob- lem generation, solution feedback is typically…
